title: Glaser quotation
content: In one of the forums (Release) there is a quotation of Milton Glaser:
author: saccade

comments.content: I don't know, but it reminds me of a favorite quotation: "the good thing about bad taste is that you don't know you have it."

You can also find this quote in the book: [The art of looking sideways](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085825/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0714834491/qid=1046813301/sr=8-1/ref=sr_8_1/104-9001284-1425500?v=glance&s=books&n=507846) by Alan Fletcher

so y not investigate on what he truly is talking about? does he mean ppl who dont have a truly firm foundation in design, would prolly direct themselves to play with style, n not concentrate on the true essence & appreciation of design?

Nice, Cheshire.   
   
I pulled that Glaser quote out a number of years back from research while I was writing my BFA thesis. I'll dig it up and see if I can find the reference.
